account_create_email_address_description: You will use this to sign in.
advanced_settings_508_description: Also known as 508 Compliance. With this feature enabled, clicking an AddThis sharing button will open a new window to a page that is keyboard navigable for people with disabilities.
advanced_settings_address_bar_shares_des: With this feature enabled, AddThis will append a code to your siteâ€™s URLs (except for the homepage) to track when a visitor comes to your site from a link someone copied out of their browser's address bar
advanced_settings_ajax_support_descripti: Are AddThis tools not loading on your site? Is your theme adding in content, excerpts or widgets asynchronously? Is your theme a single page app for WordPress? Try this. We'll add some extra code to detect when new social tools should be added onto the page.
advanced_settings_async_description: With this feature is enabled, your site will load before AddThis sharing buttons are added. If unchecked, your site will not load until AddThis buttons (and AddThis JavaScript) have been loaded by your vistors.
advanced_settings_bitly_description: When this feature is enabled, the Twitter sharing buttons will automatically use Bitly to shorten the URL tweeted. To track Bitly clickthrough with your own Bitly account, your Bitly login and key will need to be setup with your profile on {{link}}
advanced_settings_clickbacks_description: When this feature is enabled, data will be available at {{link}} to track how many people come back to your content via links shared with AddThis buttons.
advanced_settings_developer_config_descr: In this section, you can add custom JSON code to further customize your AddThis tools. For additional information on the following options, see our {{link}}.
advanced_settings_developer_config_more_: For more information, please see the AddThis documentation on the {{link}} variable.
advanced_settings_excerpt_filters_descri: Some themes create page or post excerpts in ways that break standard WordPress filters, so we hook into multiple filters to include AddThis tools on excerpts. Depending on what other plugins and your theme are doing, this may cause some problems with how our tools show up on excerpts.
advanced_settings_excerpt_filters_help: If you are seeing issues, try disabling one or more of the filters below. If you continue to see issues, plase {{link}}.
advanced_settings_google_analytics_descr: By specifying your Google Analytics Property ID, AddThis can share data into your existing Google Analytics reports, and lets you view AddThis shares as custom events in your Google Analytics dashboard.
advanced_settings_google_analytics_more_: More on AddThis' Google Analytics integration.
advanced_settings_mode_description: The system from which AddThis tool configurations should be retrieved.
advanced_settings_per_post_option_descri: With this feature is enabled, you will be able to turn off sharing buttons for specific posts on the edit page for that post.
advanced_settings_per_post_option_label: Allow Turning Off of Sharing Tools by Post
advanced_settings_script_location_descri: Sets the location of the AddThis Javascript within your page's HTML.
advanced_settings_twitter_via_descriptio: Enter your Twitter handle below and when a visitor uses an AddThis button to send a tweet about your page, your Twitter handle will be added to the end of their tweet as "via @(Your_Username)".
advanced_settings_xml_namespace_descript: When checked, this feature will add XML namespace attributes for AddThis and Facebook onto your pages. These attributes are required for valid XHTML.
advanced_settings_xml_namespace_label: Add XML Namespaces for valid XHTML
sign_in_existing_account: Sign In with an Existing Account
create_profile_description: You can create multiple profiles for your tool configuration for different sites. Please enter a name for your new profile:
error_message_invalid_api_key: The API Key is invalid. Please update your registration in the home section.
error_message_darkseid_ping_failed: We can't communicate to AddThis from your browser. This is required for this plugin to function. These requests may be blocked by privacy or ad-blocking extensions; we recommend whitelisting the addthis.com domain or disabling these extensions to help ensure functionality.
error_message_invalid_input_can_not_save: Your changes cannot be saved until the fields that have errors have been changed.
error_message_invalid_profile: The profile ID provided is invalid. Please update your registration in the home section.
error_message_profile_bad_characters: Profile name may contain only letters, numbers, spaces, dashes, underscores, and parentheses.
error_message_profile_name_too_long: Profile name must be less than 255 characters.
error_message_profile_not_on_account: Your current profile ({{profile_id}}) is not associated with this account. You may select a profile from the dropdown, create a new one, or start over and log in with a different AddThis account.
error_message_too_many_api_key_requests: Only one API key may be made per second. You may try again.
error_message_tool_check_generic: Could not retrieve settings from WordPress. Your WordPress session may have expired. Try refreshing the page. If that doesn't work, you may need to update this plugin.
error_message_unable_to_load_settings: Unable to load settings. Has your session expired?
error_message_unsupported_plugin: This version of the plugin can no longer update the settings associated with your AddThis profile. It is too old. Your AddThis tools will still function and you can update them at addthis.com or after updating this plugin.
error_message_wrong_profile_type: The profile ID provided is the wrong type. Please update your registration in the home section.
eula_template: By clicking "{{button_text}}" you certify that you are at least 13 years old, and agree to the AddThis {{privacy_policy_link}} and {{terms_of_service_link}}.
follow_service_picker_description: Click on any of the icons below, then enter your information into the entry field.
gtc_copy_in_the_shortcode: Use this shortcode to insert your follow buttons inline in your WordPress posts and pages.
gtc_drag_the_widget: Drag the {{name}} widget into the desired location in your theme's available widget areas, and select this tool from the dropdown menu in the widget.
gtc_go_to_widgets_page: In your WordPress Dashboard, go to Appearance > Widgets, or {{link}}
icon_color_picker_custom_input_alt: Enter a custom HEX color prepended by #
icon_shape_picker_round_option_alt: Click here to select a round shape for your buttons
icon_shape_picker_rounded_option_alt: Click here to select a rounded corners shape for your buttons
icon_shape_picker_square_option_alt: Click here to select a square shape for your buttons
layers_hide_on_homepage_description: This will only hide the tool on a top-level homepage like www.addthis.com, not on homepages like www.addthis.com/blog
layers_hide_on_these_pages_description: Hint: Use an asterisk (*) to hide on multiple pages (e.g., *.addthis.com, www.addthis.com/blog*)
manual_registration_link: Link your AddThis account to WordPress manually
manual_registration_radio_button_label_f: Use the tool configurations associated with this profile
Ignore the tool configurations in this profile
manual_registration_wordpress_mode_incom: This mode is not compatible with this plugin.
manual_registration_wordpress_mode_warni: A limited set of tools will be available to you in this mode. For more tools (including Pro tools for Pro account), select the other mode.
plugin_description_follow_buttons: Generate followers for your social networks and track what pages are generating the most followers. Set up follow tools from AddThis right in WordPress. With AddThis you can see how your users are engaging with your content, provide a personalized experience for each user and encourage them to share your content in their social networks. Sharing tools, recommended content, conversion tools and social analytics available to registered accounts at addthis.com.
plugin_description_maximum: Set up sharing, follow and recommended content tools from AddThis right in WordPress. With AddThis you can see how your users are engaging with your content, provide a personalized experience for each user and encourage them to share, subscribe or follow. Conversion tools and social analytics available to registered accounts at addthis.com.
plugin_description_minimum: Easily link your WordPress site to access all AddThis tools, and control and edit easily through the AddThis dashboard.
plugin_description_share_buttons: Set up sharing tools from AddThis right in WordPress. With AddThis you can see how your users are engaging with your content, provide a personalized experience for each user and encourage them to share your content in their social networks. Follow tools, recommended content, conversion tools and social analytics available to registered accounts at addthis.com.
promoted_url_input_label: Promote a Specific Page into the First Slot
recommended_content_check_message: AddThis has not yet crawled your site to gather content recommendations. Any related post tools you add to your site will show up once we have something to recommend. It can take us up to 24 hours to crawl your site. If you still see this message after 24 hours, you can reach our to the AddThis Support team at {{support_site_link}} or {{support_email_address_link}}
registered_configure_at_addthis: With Website Tools by AddThis, you configure all of your tools using the AddThis Dashboard.
registered_intro_description_custom_mess: Increase subscriptions, signups and registration with Audience Targeting rules
registered_intro_description_follow_tool: Drive more followers and likes with bold, beautiful social follow buttons.
registered_intro_description_recommended: Keep visitors engaged by showing them top trending content on your site.
registered_intro_description_share_tools: Increase traffic on your site by offering simple ways for visitors to share your content.
review_nag_do_you_like_us: Did you find this plugin useful?
review_nag_let_us_know_how_to_improve: Let us know how we can improve our plugin through our support forum or by emailing {{emailAddressLink}}.
select_profile_description: We've pre-selected the profile you're already using. You may change it below, if desired. Changing to a different profile may change your settings for AddThis tools on this site.
select_profile_select_directions: You may select one of your existing AddThis profiles or create a new one to associate with this site.
select_profile_warning_wrong_profile_typ: The selected profile is not a WordPress profile type. If you use this profile, the profile type will be updated and the settings will be reset.
service_picker_available_choices_descrip: Select your own Services and customize the order.
settings_conflict_follow_description: We noticed you're using multiple accounts for the same follow service on the same tool. Please choose one account per service for each tool.
settings_conflict_full_description: The new advanced settings you select below will replace the settings for all AddThis plugins.
settings_conflict_mobile_message: To pick and choose settings from each plugin, please open this page in a larger browser
settings_conflict_simple_description: It looks like your AddThis WordPress plugins have conflicting settings. Select which plugin's settings you would like to use across all of your AddThis plugins.
settings_conflict_use_from_plugin: Pick and choose settings from each plugin
share_service_picker_disabled_descriptio: Sharing buttons are automatically personalized for each visitor to help increase sharing.
sign_in_do_not_have_account: Don't have an account? Create one below.
sign_in_minimalist_intro: With the Website Tools by AddThis Plugin, you'll have the ability to access the entire suite of AddThis website marketing tools, including sharing and Audience Targeting rules. Using the AddThis dashboard, activate your tools, monitor their performance and make changes in seconds all in one place.
sign_in_minimalist_note: NOTE: You will need an AddThis account to use the Website Tools by AddThis plugin.
sign_in_registration_optional: Registration is optional and unlocks additional features.
sign_in_sign_in_below: Already have an account? Sign in below
sign_in_title: Welcome to Website Tools by AddThis
smart_layers_custom_api_config_failed_ex: We really, really tried, but were unable to upgrade your Custom API Configurations. You can review your old custom settings below and add them back in manually. Once you've moved them over, click
tool_cflwh_example_image_alt: An example image of custom follow buttons. The buttons are in the right part of the image, to the side of grayed out images and text. It has 4 round icons lined up horizontally, with the text "Follow:" directly above them. In this example, from left to right, the follow buttons are logos for Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and LinkedIn. Each logo is white on a solid gray background color.
tool_cflwh_long_description: Don't sacrifice design with these custom sharing buttons. You can choose to match the look and feel of your site by choosing your own colors, shape of the button and whether or not to display the share counter.
tool_cflwh_short_description: These custom follow buttons allow you to match the look and feel of your website.
tool_cod_example_image_alt: An example image of a Recommended Content Drawer. This tool is on the right of the screen, with grayed out text and image on the left. It lists 3 article vertically with large images, text imposed on the bottom of the images.
tool_cod_long_description: Help keep visitors on your site and discover new content with the Recommended Content Drawer. The drawer shows up on the side of your page and displays content that is related and currently trending.
tool_cod_short_description: Keep visitors on your site and help them discover content based on what's trending and related.
tool_flwh_example_image_alt: An example image of horiztonal follow buttons. The buttons are in the right part of the image, to the side of grayed out images and text. It has 4 square icons lined up horizontally, with the text "Follow:" directly above them. In this example, from left to right, the follow buttons are logos for Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and LinkedIn. Each logo is white on a solid background color that matches each social service's brand
tool_flwh_long_description: Get more followers by adding there Horizontal Follow buttons in the footer or sidebar of your site.
tool_flwh_short_description: Get more followers by adding there Horizontal Follow buttons in the footer or sidebar of your site.
tool_flwv_example_image_alt: An example image of vertical follow buttons. The buttons are in the right part of the image, to the side of grayed out images and text. It has 4 square icons stacked vertically, with the text "Follow:" directly above them. Directly to the right of each icon is the name of the service in blue. In this example, from top to bottom, the follow buttons are logos for Facebook, Twitter, Instragram and Pinterest. Each logo is white on a solid background color that matches each social service's brand
tool_flwv_long_description: Increase your followers by adding these buttons in the footer or sidebar of your site.
tool_flwv_short_description: Increase your followers by adding these buttons in the footer or sidebar of your site.
tool_jrcf_example_image_alt: An example image of Jumbo Recommended Content Footer. This tool is on the bottom the screen, with grayed out text above it. It lists the title of 1 article white letters on top of a dimmed image of a rocky beach.
tool_jrcf_long_description: This tool highlights recommended content by showcasing it through the use of jumbo images at the bottom of your site. The Jumbo Recommended Content Footer shows content that is trending and related.
tool_jrcf_short_description: Highlight recommended trending or related content by showcasing it at the bottom of your site.
tool_listing_custom_message_example_imag: An example image of a custom message used to target an audience. The message pops up above the content on the page, and grays out the background. There are a couple lines of text at the top of the pop up, and then two buttons at the bottom. The left buttons is blue, the right buttons is gray.
tool_listing_jrcf_alt: Jumbo Recommended Content Footer Tool Listing
tool_listing_toggle_disabled_alt: This tool is disabled. Click to enable.
tool_listing_toggle_enabled_alt: This tool is enabled. Click to disable.
tool_msd_example_image_alt: An example image of a mobile sharing toolbar looks like on a smart phone's screen. The tools is in the bottom of the phone's screen, below grayed out text. It has four icons aligned horizontally on the screen. The four icons are Facebook, Twitter, Send Email, and a plus for more. Each icon is white on a solid background color that matches each social service's brand.
tool_msd_long_description: This sharing toolbar is made for mobile responsiveness and floats above your site, truncating or expanding for optimal mobile user experience.
tool_msd_short_description: Get more likes and shares from mobile visitors.
tool_scopl_example_image_alt: An example image of original sharing buttons. The buttons are in the left part of the image, above and to the left of grayed out text, and below a grayed out image. The tool has 4 icons of different styles lined up horizontally, with a bubble with the text 847 to the right. In this example, from left to right, the share buttons are a Facebook like button, Twitter Tweet button, Pinterest PinIt button, and an AddThis share buttons (which is a plus sign followed by the test Share, to indicate more services available upon click).
tool_scopl_long_description: Use the original AddThis sharing buttons that visitors know and love that encourages users to share directly to their social networks that visitors know and love.
tool_scopl_short_description: The original share buttons encourage users to share directly to their social networks.
tool_settings_jrcf_alt: Jumbo Recommended Content Footer Tool Settings
tool_settings_share_count_threshold_desc: This controls when your share counts start to show on your button
tool_smlfw_example_image_alt: An example image of a follow header. The header is in the upper right hand corner, floating over grayed out images and text in the background. It has 4 circular icons lined up horizontally, prepended by the word
tool_smlfw_long_description: Grow your social audience with floating follow buttons to help get more followers.
tool_smlfw_short_description: Grow your social audience with floating follow buttons to help get more followers.
tool_smlmo_example_image_alt: An example image of a mobile toolbar looks like on a smart phone's screen. The tool is in the bottom of the phone's screen, below grayed out text. It has a light gray background and black text. On the left is reads "Follow" and on the right it reads "Share." There is light gray bar seperating the two words.
tool_smlmo_long_description: Made specifically for optimal mobile user experience, the Mobile Toolbar helps to increase sharing and following from mobile visitors by floating at the top or the bottom of the screen.
tool_smlmo_short_description: This tool floats above your site, truncating or expaning for optimal mobile user experience.
tool_smlre_example_image_alt: An example image of a Recommended Content Footer tool. The tools is in the bottom of the screen, below grayed out text. It lists 4 article aligned horizontally with an image above some text for each article.
tool_smlre_long_description: Help keep visitors on your site and discover new content with the Recommended Content Footer. The recommendations shows up on the bottom of your page and displays content that is related and currently trending.
tool_smlre_short_description: Keep visitors on your site and discover new content based on what's trending and related.
tool_smlrebh_example_image_alt: An example image of a horizontal recommended content tool. The tools is in the bottom left part of the image, below and to the side of grayed out images and text. It lists 4 articles aligned horizontally, each with an image above some text.
tool_smlrebh_long_description: Use this tool to showcase related posts and images below your articles or on your homepage to keep visitors engaged and on your site. Recommendations are based on related content and what is currently trending.
tool_smlrebh_short_description: Showcase content recommendations and images to keep visitors engaged and on your site.
tool_smlrebv_example_image_alt: An example image of a Vertical Recommended Content tool. The tools right part of the image, with grayed out images and text on the left. It lists 4 articles aligned vertically, each with an image to the left of some text.
tool_smlrebv_long_description: Use this tool to showcase recommended content and images below your articles or on your homepage to keep visitors engaged and on your site. Recommendations are based on related content and what is currently trending.
tool_smlrebv_short_description: Showcase content recommendations and images to keep visitors engaged and on your site.
tool_smlsh_example_image_alt: An example image of a sharing toolbar. The toolbar is on the left edge of the image, floating over grayed out images and text in the background. In this example, from top to bottom, the sharing buttons are logos for Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn and a big plus for more. The first four sharing buttons include a share count below each logo. Each logo is white on a solid background color that matches each social service's brand.
tool_smlsh_long_description: This simple tool is the easiest way to increase sharing upt o 2x over our traditional sharing buttons. It floats on the side of your page and showcases how many other visitors have shared your content across their social networks.
tool_smlsh_short_description: The easiest way to increase sharing up to 2x over regular sharing buttons.
tool_smlwn_example_image_alt: An example image of a What's Next recommended content tool. The tools is in the bottom right part of the image, below and to the side of grayed out images and text. It lists 1 article with an image to the left of some text.
tool_smlwn_long_description: Keep visitors on your site with automatic related posts as they scroll down. Recommendations are based on what is related and currently trending.
tool_smlwn_short_description: Keep visitors on your site with automatic content recommendations as they scroll down.
tool_tbx_example_image_alt: An example image of sharing buttons. The buttons are in the left part of the image, above and to the left of grayed out text, and below a grayed out image. The tool has 5 square icons lined up horizontally, with a bubble with the text 2.2M to the right. In this example, from left to right, the sharing buttons are logos for Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn and AddThis (which is a plus sign, to indicate more services available upon click). Each logo is white on a solid background color that matches each social service's brand
tool_tbx_long_description: Use these share buttons to grab visitors attention and increase sharing across devices. These buttons will automatically show visitors the correct sharing buttons for them based on their social preferences.
tool_tbx_short_description: Use these share buttons to grab visitors attention and increase sharing across devices.
tool_tst_example_image_alt: An example image of a Recommended Content Toaster. This tool is on the bottom right of the screen, with grayed out text and image around it. It lists 2 article horizontally with large images and text below the images.
tool_tst_long_description: This tool shows recommendations that are trending and related content.
tool_tst_short_description: Help users discover new content based on what's trending and related as they scroll down the page.
tool_wnm_example_image_alt: An example image of a What's Next Mobile recommended content tool on a smart phone's screen. The tools is in the bottom of the phone's screen, below grayed out text. It lists 1 article with an image to the left of some text on a black background.
tool_wnm_long_description: The What's Next tool shows your visitors recommended content as they scroll down to help keep them engaged and on your site. Recommendations are based on what is related and currently trending.
tool_wnm_short_description: This mobile friendly tool recommends related and trending content as they scroll down your site.
warning_message_advanced_settings_async: When the AddThis JavaScript is loaded in asynchronously, AddThis buttons may not always load.
warning_message_advanced_settings_clickb: Without clickbacks enabled, AddThis will not be able to provide you with analytics about how much traffic social shares are driving to your site.
warning_message_advanced_settings_excerp: If no excerpt filters are enabled, AddThis tools will not be automatically added onto any excerpts. Excerpts are often used on homepages, archive pages, and category pages.
warning_message_advanced_settings_script: If added into the header, the AddThis JavaScript may delay when the content of your page is loaded. Adding our scripts into the footer helps this, by loading AddThis JavaScript only after the majority of your page has loaded.
warning_message_changing_from_wordpress_: Continuing with the registration process will switch you over to AddThis mode and this plugin will use your tool configurations associated with your AddThis profile. If you do not want to be in AddThis mode, you can change the mode back over on the manual registration page.
warning_message_cross_plugin_copy_profil: Click here to copy your profile from this plugin ({{profile_id}}) into {{old_plugin_name}}.
Click here to copy your profile from this plugin ({{profile_id}}) into {{old_plugin_name}}. This may override some of your settings in the {{old_plugin_name}}.
Click here to copy your profile from this plugin ({{profile_id}}) into both. This may override some of your settings in the {{old_welcome_bar_plugin_name}}.
warning_message_cross_plugin_fb_and_wb_m: Do you have the {{old_follow_plugin_name}} or the {{old_welcome_bar_plugin_name}} plugin activated? They are using a different AddThis profile ({{profile_id}}). This can cause issues.
warning_message_cross_plugin_fb_and_wb_n: Do you have the {{old_follow_plugin_name}} or the {{old_welcome_bar_plugin_name}} plugin activated? They are not set up with AddThis profiles. This can cause issues.
warning_message_cross_plugin_mismatched_: Do you have the {{old_plugin_name}} plugin activated? It is using a different AddThis profile ({{profile_id}}). This can cause issues.
warning_message_cross_plugin_mode_fixed: Your {{old_share_plugin_name}} plugin is now in AddThis mode.
warning_message_cross_plugin_no_profile_: Do you have the {{old_plugin_name}} plugin activated? It is not set up with an AddThis profile. This can cause issues.
warning_message_cross_plugin_other_plugi: Do you have the {{old_plugin_name}} plugin activated? This plugin may not play nicely with it. Specifically, your options in one plugin or the other may be ignored.
Do you have the old {{old_plugin_name}} plugin activated (version 1.3.1 or older)? This plugin may not play nicely with it. Specifically, your options in one plugin or the other may be ignored.
warning_message_cross_plugin_share_butto: Do you have an old version of the {{old_share_plugin_name}} plugin activated? This plugin may not play nicely with it. Specifically, you may end up with sharing buttons and related posts showing up twice. If you run into issues, please deactivate either the out of date {{old_share_plugin_name}} plugin or this one.
warning_message_cross_plugin_wordpress_m: Do you have the {{old_share_plugin_name}} plugin activated? Your configurations from AddThis.com won't show up on your site until the {{old_share_plugin_name}} plugin is in AddThis mode.
warning_message_minimal_plugin_wordpress: This plugin isn't compatible with WordPress mode. This plugin only functions when using the tool configurations associated with an AddThis profile.
warning_message_smart_layers_custom_api_: We really, really tried, but were unable to upgrade your Custom API Configurations. You can review your old custom settings and add them back in manually in {{advanced_settings_link}} >> {{developer_configuration}} >> addthis.layers(). A copy of your old settings will be available there for your reference.
warning_message_widget_conflict: Uh oh! We couldn't automatically upgrade this widget. This widget still works, but if you would like to change its configuration please delete it, go to %1$s, update your tool settings, then come back here to add an a new AddThis Tool widget.
widget_description_by_dom_class: AddThis Share, Follow and Related Post Tools
widget_description_by_dom_class_activate: No active tools yet. Go activate some!'
widget_description_by_dom_class_bad_clas: Error! The tool with id {{class}} does not exist in your settings. Please select another tool.
widget_description_script: If your theme is not adding the AddThis script (addthis_widget.js) onto your pages, try adding this widget.
widget_edit_link: To edit the options for your AddThis tools, please go to {{link}}
widget_edit_links: To edit the options for your AddThis tools, please go to {{plugin_settings}} or {{addthis_website}}
share_tool_custom_html_description: This text box allows you to enter any AddThis markup that you wish. To see examples of what you can do, visit AddThis.com Sharing Tools and select any sharing tool. You can also check out our API. For any help you may need, please visit AddThis Support.
not_allowed_to_do_unfiltered_html: You don't have permission to enter unfiltered HTML. Please contact your WordPress administrator if you need this permission.
advanced_settings_enqueue_client_descrip: How should addthis_widget.js (the script that creates AddThis tools) be added onto your site?
warning_message_advanced_settings_enqueu: If wp_enqueue_scripts is selected, then asynchronous loading of this script will not be available.
If wp_enqueue_scripts is selected, then (a) asynchronous loading of this script will not be available, (b) control over which floating tools appear on which templates will not be available.
advanced_settings_enqueue_local_settings: How should the script with your local AddThis settings be added onto your site?
